Isaiah or Isaias__22.1: The burden of <u>the valley of vision</u>. What aileth thee also, that thou too art wholly gone up to the housetops?
Isaiah or Isaias__22.2: Full of clamour, a populous city, a joyous city: thy slain are not slain by the sword, nor dead in battle.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.3: All the princes are fled together, and are bound hard: all that were found, are bound together, they are fled far off.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.4: Therefore have I said: Depart from me, I will weep bitterly: labour not to comfort me, for the devastation of the daughter of my people.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.5: For it is a day of slaughter and of treading down, and of weeping to the Lord the God of hosts in the valley of vision, searching the wall, and magnificent upon the mountain.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.6: And Elam took the quiver, the chariot of the horseman, and the shield was taken down from the wall.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.7: And thy choice valleys shall be full of chariots, and the horseman shall place themselves in the gate.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.8: And the covering of Juda shall be discovered, and thou shalt see in that day the armoury of the house of the forest.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.9: And you shall see the breaches of the city of David, that they are many: and you have gathered together the waters of the lower pool,
Isaiah or Isaias__22.10: And have numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and broken down houses to fortify the wall.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.11: And you made a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: and you have not looked up to the maker thereof, nor regarded him even at a distance, that wrought it long ago.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.12: And the Lord, the God of hosts, in that day shall call to weeping, and to mourning, to baldness, and to girding with sackcloth:
Isaiah or Isaias__22.13: And behold joy and gladness, killing calves, and slaying rams, eating flesh, and drinking wine: Let us eat and drink; for tomorrow we shall die.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.14: And the voice of the Lord of hosts was revealed in my ears: Surely this iniquity shall not be forgiven you till you die, saith the Lord God of hosts.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.15: Thus saith the Lord God of hosts: Go, get thee in to him that dwelleth in the tabernacle, to Sobna who is over the temple: and thou shalt say to him:
Isaiah or Isaias__22.16: What dost thou here, or as if thou wert somebody here? for thou hast hewed thee out a sepulchre here, thou hast hewed out a monument carefully in a high place, a dwelling for thyself in a rock.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.17: Behold the Lord will cause thee to be carried away, as a cock is carried away, and he will lift thee up as a garment.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.18: He will crown thee with a crown of tribulation, he will toss thee like a ball into a large and spacious country: there shalt thou die, and there shall the chariot of thy glory be, the shame of the house of thy Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.19: And I will drive thee out From thy station, and depose thee from thy ministry.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.20: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my servant Eliacim the son of Helcias,
Isaiah or Isaias__22.21: And I will clothe him with thy robe, and will strengthen him with thy girdle, and will give thy power into his hand: and he shall be as a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Juda.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.22: And I will lay the key of the house of David upon his shoulder: and he shall open, and none shall shut: and he shall shut, and none shall open.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.23: And I will fasten him as a peg in a sure place, and he shall be for a throne of glory to the house of his father.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.24: And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father's house, divers kinds of vessels, every little vessel, from the vessels of cups even to every instrument of music.
Isaiah or Isaias__22.25: In that day, saith the Lord of hosts, shall the peg be removed, that was fastened in the sure place: and it shall be broken and shall fall: and that which hung thereon, shall perish, because the Lord hath spoken it.
